intro: Neurolaena oaxacana, commonly known as Oaxacan false dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of native flora.
